result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauralie S. Lepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement, elements & JI's

Case called at 1:01 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Lauralie S. Lepper in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered knowlingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1, #2, #3 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other sentence in being, with conditions as listed on the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment per Agent
--Random drug screening
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs of $972 ($243 each count)
--To pay $800 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $222 subpoena fees (On Count #1)

Court does not order a DNA Sample

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court orders Miss Lepper to report to JESO for booking
Sentence may transfer to another State if approved by Agent
Recess: 1:45 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Lauralie S. Lepper
Current: 3474 Valley View Dr, Muskegon, MI 49444 United States  (Effective: 06-18-2015)
Prior: 317 N. Third St, Watertown, WI 53094
Original signature bond received in the mail from Taycheedah Correctional Institution
Proposed Order to Produce
Jury trial on June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:48am [mo]
Defendant Lauralie S. Lepper in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to the State's Motion to grant all submitted Motion's on the basis that Defense has not responded to State's Motion's in timely matter, as proposed in the Branch III Scheduling Order:
--Atty. Svehlek apologizes for not filing a response

On State's 4/10/15 Motion in Limine:
--The Court grants

On State's 4/10/15 Motion to Impeach with Priors:
--The Court grants
--For purposes of Trial Ms. Lepper has 5 priors

On State's 4/10/15 Notice to Admit Statements:
--The Court grants

Atty. Svehlek requests an adjournment of the scheduled FSSC and Jury Trial and withdraws the previously entered Speedy Demand, due to Ms. Lepper's ongoing treatment
--The State does not take a position
--The Court accepts withdraw of former speedy trial demand
--The Court orders for the scheduled FSSC and Jury Trial dates to be removed from the calendar. 
recess: 9:58am

NEXT: (1) FSSC: June 22, 2015 at 1:00pm (2)JURY TRIAL: June 25 OR 26, 2015 at 8:30am ((Ms. Lepper will be out of custody by these date and a Writ will not need to be prepared))

[MK] case called at 1:46pm. 
Defendant Lauralie S. Lepper appears via videoconferencing from the Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Her counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek is in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the Defense.

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Charles Joseph or Ronald Mondl 
--no presence at 317 N. Third Street in Watertown
The Court issues its written trial Scheduling Order 
recess 1:54 pm. 


NEXT:  (1) FSSC on 5/11/15 at 3:30pm  (JA- please note in comments that speedy trial time limits pend;  no transport is to be done for this hearing unless Attorney Svehlek indicates that the case is proceeding to final hearing  (2) Jury Trial on 5/21 or 5/22/15 at 8:30am
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
